subject: Economics
title: Behavioral Finance: When Markets Go Crazy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Behavioral Finance: When Markets Go Crazy.

hook.text: If markets were rational, there would be no bubbles, no crashes, and no day traders losing their savings.

buildup.text: Behavioral finance combines psychology with economics to explain why markets deviate from efficient market theory.

discovery.text: Robert Shiller predicted both the dot-com crash and the 2008 housing crisis using behavioral indicators like.

twist.text: Shiller and Eugene Fama (who believes markets ARE efficient) shared the 2013 Nobel Prize.

climax.text: Markets are mostly efficient, occasionally insane.
